Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates Garland's role in the decision by stating that he "voted to uphold" the handgun ban, when in fact he did not vote on the case at all.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that Garland voted to uphold the handgun ban.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Garland's nomination should be rejected solely based on his supposed stance on Second Amendment rights, without considering other qualifications or factors.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, as it was actually Judge Karen Henderson who dissented in the D.C. Circuit opinion, not Garland.
